basics.name: Gabriela Surita
basics.summary: Hi! I'm Gabriela Surita. I'm a senior year computer engineering student at University of Campinas and certified part time software developer. My best skill is to be able to combine practical, self-taught, and quick hacking solutions with software engineering good practices.

work.summary: Conservancy is a non-profit organization that promotes Outreachy - An internship program for people underrepresented in the computer science and free software community.
highlights: Mainly worked with a Mozilla developed Open Source distributed HTTP storage service - Kinto.
Documented, tested and patched some inconsistencies in the Kinto API.
Worked with OpenAPI/Swagger documentation standards writing automated documentation tools and API compliance test environments.
Directly contributed to more than a dozen open software repositories.
Mastered continuous integration, TDD, and other free software development techniques.
Submitted patches to large projects such as Pyramid, Colander and Swagger.
Worked with a diverse distributed team.

work.summary: Mesonn Instruments is a startup that produces digital measuring instruments for synchrotron laboratories and general purposes.
highlights: Communicating pure FGPA designs with Ethernet.
Writing Verilog/VHDL Hardware specifications.
Using embedded Linux and in C/C++.
Reimplementing network protocols on highly constrained environments.

work.summary: LASCA stands for Laboratory of Security and Cryptography and is the main research facility for digital security from University of Campinas. LASCA had a partnership with Intel that included scholarships for Junior researchers on Intel related projects.
highlights: Worked with cryptographic hardware primitives designs such as TRNGs and PUFs.
Studied with Machine learning based attacks on security primitives.
Authored two articles, one for an international conference, about PUF Security properties.
Contributed to other research projects implementing efficient hardware-based cryptosystems on topics like electronic voting and low cost IoT authentication.

work.summary: 3E Unicamp is a Junior enterprise that provides consulting services from teachers and skilled students on the fields of Electrical and Computer Engineering.
highlights: Worked as a contract software developer building websites and webservices in Django.
Wrote Front-End applications using Javascript, CSS and HTML
Used continuous integration and Test Driven Development.

work.summary: Spaço is a local advertisement company focused on Web solutions for small businesses.
highlights: Developed Applications and WordPress extensions in PHP.
Managed Apache Servers and MySQL databases.
Co-managed a plural team mainly composed by designers.

volunteer.summary: Global movement to teach and encourage women to follow careers in computer science.
highlights: Teach computer science introduction and machine learning courses to women and teenagers using Python.

publications.name: Cylindrical Reconvergence PUF
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 19th Euromicro Symposium on Digital Systems Design
publications.summary: Propose a new architecture of Physical Unclonable Function that shows a better trade-off between hardware footprint and resistance to machine learning modelling attacks.

publications.name: Open Source Platform for digital Simulation of Delay Based PUFs
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 18th Undergraduate Scientific Research Congress of Unicamp
publications.summary: Propose and evaluate a digital simulation model for Physical Unclonable Functions hardware security primitives.

languages.fluency: Read and write well, Speaks poorly
